meanings.sent1: The cat will flisk across the room.
meanings.sent2: She likes to flisk when she is excited.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to flisk away from the approaching dog.
meanings.sent4: The leaves flisked in the wind like tiny dancers.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah's flisking speed amazed the onlookers.

meanings.sent1: With a flisk, the rabbit darted into its burrow.
meanings.sent2: The unexpected flisk of the lizard startled me.
meanings.sent3: The flisk of the curtain caught me off guard.
meanings.sent4: The flisk of the fish as it jumped out of the water was impressive.
meanings.sent5: The flisk of the falling branch narrowly missed the hiker.

meanings.definition: To flick or toss something lightly.
meanings.sent1: She will flisk the pebble into the pond.
meanings.sent2: He likes to flisk his hair back when he's thinking.
meanings.sent3: The chef will flisk the seasoning onto the dish.
meanings.sent4: The magician will flisk the coin into the air for his trick.
meanings.sent5: The child's laughter filled the room as she flisked the ball to her friend.
